Scott Brown challenges Elizabeth Warren to debate

US Senator Scott Brown today challenged rival Elizabeth Warren to a debate, and Warren's campaign has issued a noncommittal response. (Globe, 12:57 p.m.)
  • Elizabeth Warren muscles challenger out of Senate race
  • Warren: Ready' for 'nasty' campaign | More on the race

Passenger plane crashes in Nigeria

The Dana Air flight was flying from Abuja to Lagos with 153 people on board, the Lagos state government said, and crashed through multiple buildings. (AP, 2:49 p.m.)

Actor, 'Family Feud' host Richard Dawson dies at 79

Richard Dawson starred in "Hogan's Heroes" and later became famous for kissing female contestants as host of the TV game show "Family Feud."
  • Sign the guest book | 'Family Feud' host Dawson dies

Rocky rollout to era of Mass. casinos

There have been more problems than progress in the first six months of casinos in the Bay State, which have been hampered by controversies and false starts. (Globe)

Flood warnings issued in Maine, N.H.

The National Weather Service has issued flood warnings across parts of Maine and New Hampshire as heavy rains continue falling across the region. (AP, 3:08 p.m.)

Charity gives Boston
youth a sporting chance

The nonprofit Play Ball Inc. has established interscholastic sports programs for middle schoolers throughout a cash-strapped system.

Kevin Garnett has been fun to follow

The Celtics veteran, 17 years into his Hall of Fame career, remains unique in style and range of big man skill and is still an elite player.

Student worker visas draw ire

Resort areas are turning to foreign students for help, but some say the visa system hurts their US peers.
Opinion | Joan Vennochi

The persistence of politics as usual

Deval Patrick, the candidate, promised to change the state’s political culture. But under Patrick, the governor, it doesn’t look or feel that different.

38 Studios’ troubles could
cool enthusiasm for tax breaks

Video game industry officials acknowledged they could face a tough time persuading Mass. to enact incentives after the meltdown of Curt Schilling’s company.
Opinion | Yvonne Abraham

A giant candy bar, and a bigger heart

Instead of eating his school fund-raising prize, Francis Shea parlayed the 5-pound Hershey’s Bar into a money-maker for another charity.

News

Zimmerman back in custody in Fla.

Zimmerman's legal team said he is back in custody, two days after a judge ordered him back to jail. Zimmerman's bail was revoked because the judge said he and his wife lied about their finances to obtain a lower bond.
